ports.name: URL
ports.text: The audio file to load. Mostly you will drag an audio file into the cables window and select it via the file-chooser in the op parameter view. Depending on the browser you use (or user who will see / hear your exported patch) only certain file types can be played back. MP3 seems to be the best supported audio format.

ports.name: Audio Buffer
ports.text: The loaded audio buffer, can be connected to e.g. `AudioBufferPlayer`

ports.name: Sample Rate
ports.text: The sample rate of the sample in samples per second, of the PCM data stored in the buffer.

ports.name: Length
ports.text: Length of the buffer, in sample-frames, of the PCM data stored in the buffer.

ports.name: Duration
ports.text: Duration, in seconds, of the PCM data stored in the buffer

ports.name: Number of Channels
ports.text: How many channels the audio file contains, `2` means stereo
